p: In the FT-IR analysis ( Fig. 3), the slight shifts noted in broad peaks at 3350.83 cm −1 for AECR and 3281.03 cm −1 for AECR-AuNPs, indicate the presence of the O—H stretch for alcohol or phenol. Also, the 1632.93 cm −1 and 1638.58 cm −1 for AECR-AuNPs and AECR, respectively, corresponded to C—O and N—H stretching and bending for carboxylic acids and amides. This suggests that polyphenolic compounds and proteins were involved in the synthesis of AuNPs through the reduction of gold salt to AuNPs. Phenolic compounds reportedly have excellent binding affinity to metal ions, thereby aiding the reduction of gold ions (Au 3+) to gold atoms and induce chelation effect [ 39]. The presence of carboxylate groups on proteins serve as surfactant for the synthesis of nanoparticles, thereby enabling excellent affinity of the proteins for AuNPs [ 40]. These prevents the aggregation of the nanoparticles [ 39, 40].
